page.title: 15TRANSPORT AND COMMUNICATION
page.content: The main road running through the area is the B6480 it is fairly busy because it is part of the shortest route from Lancaster to Leeds. On the other hand it would not be considered busy by urban standards. The bus service along this road is regular but infrequent particularly at weekends and most of the population find that private transport is essential if they are to maintain a normal life. A survey conducted from a point on the village green at Wennington between 9 am and 3 pm on Wednesday, 10 July 1985 showed that cars are easily the most frequent users of this route: in this period 685 cars were recorded, 85 lorries, 141 vans, 23 agricultural vehicles and 2 coaches. At the same time a mere 4 buses went past.
